body_html: @vishwakftw I still like Adam's suggestion of making ._natural_params, ._log_normalizer() and ._mean_carrier_measure private, since they are only used to implement generic methods. Mostly I don't want to confuse users of e.g. Normal with internal-only methods, since that detracts attention from important methods like .rsample() and .entropy(). Does that sound reasonable?
body_text: @vishwakftw I still like Adam's suggestion of making ._natural_params, ._log_normalizer() and ._mean_carrier_measure private, since they are only used to implement generic methods. Mostly I don't want to confuse users of e.g. Normal with internal-only methods, since that detracts attention from important methods like .rsample() and .entropy(). Does that sound reasonable?
body: @vishwakftw I still like Adam's suggestion of making `._natural_params`, `._log_normalizer()` and `._mean_carrier_measure` private, since they are only used to implement generic methods. Mostly I don't want to confuse users of e.g. `Normal` with internal-only methods, since that detracts attention from important methods like `.rsample()` and `.entropy()`. Does that sound reasonable?
